page.title: 01LODSWORTH,RIVER & SELHAM
page.content: Most of the block is cultivated farmland, pasture, woodland and polo- grounds.Little of the area is taken up by buildings. The hamlet of{Selham}is to the south of the Petworth to Midhurst road,Halfway Bridge straddles it and the hamlet of{River}lies east across the valley of the Lod from the village of{LODSWORTH.}The narrow lanes inhibit through traffic; meet a tractor or horsebox,a herd or flock and you may need to squeeze into the hedge.Woodland to the north,Petworth Park to the east, downland views to the south,Cowdray Park to the west,the village boasts many fine dwellings. Recent council houses at Oakfield have enabled more people to live amidst its calm and serenity.
